entries.title: The DOJ sues Google for ad dominance, wants to break company up
entries.description: US trust-busters want to take the DoubleClick out of Google.

entries.title: Activision Blizzard studio says CEO pressure stymied their union efforts
entries.description: Proletariat union cites "confrontational tactics" from CEO that "took their toll."

entries.title: It’s getting easier to buy bigger SSDs for the Steam Deck and Surface PCs
entries.description: Special 30-mm-long SSDs are gradually coming to retail, though big names are MIA.

entries.title: With Nvidia Eye Contact, you’ll never look away from a camera again
entries.description: Creepy AI-powered eyeballs maintain direct eye contact even if you avert your gaze.

entries.title: Lawsuit: Twitter stopped paying rent at headquarters after Musk took over
entries.description: Twitter didn't pay $3.4M rent bills in December and January, building owner says.

entries.title: SpaceX completes fueling test, will now work toward massive engine firing test
entries.description: SpaceX said it loaded more than 10 million pounds of fuel onto the vehicle.

entries.title: PC peripheral makers are feeling tech’s pandemic boom hangover too
entries.description: Even Logitech, a top beneficiary of pandemic-driven tech purchases, is hurting.

entries.title: Appliance makers sad that 50% of customers won’t connect smart appliances
entries.description: Did users change their Wi-Fi password, or did they see the nature of IoT privacy?

entries.title: Chris Pine battles undead army in Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves trailer
entries.description: "I lost everything that ever mattered to me. If we quit now, that's for nothing."

entries.title: Why is GTP suddenly the hottest thing in racing?
entries.description: The big question ahead of this weekend's race is whether the cars will survive.

entries.title: Rocket Lab set to try its first US-based launch again
entries.description: The company's Electron launch vehicle is ready to take 3 small satellites to orbit.

entries.title: European launch chief insists there be no competition with Ariane rockets
entries.description: "A huge mistake would be that this focus on microlaunchers destabilizes Ariane 6 and Vega C."

entries.title: The world’s farms are hooked on phosphorus, and that’s a problem
entries.description: Nonrenewable fertilizer powers 50% of Earth's agricultural productivity.

entries.title: The Polestar 2 gets new electric motors in mid-life refresh
entries.description: Cosmetic changes include a new front, and the single-motor car is now rear-driven.
